TACM-T1.label: Opportunistic
TACM-T1.description: Uses publicly available exploit code, commodity malware (cracked Cobalt Strike, Mimikatz), mass phishing, RDP brute force. No target selection — attacks whoever is vulnerable. Minimal evasion.
tradecraftIndicators: Indiscriminate target selection — scans for known vulnerabilities, exposed RDP, weak credentials
Mass phishing, exploit public-facing applications (CVE < 30 days old), brute force
Commodity tooling — cracked Cobalt Strike, Mimikatz, PowerShell Empire, off-the-shelf ransomware
Minimal evasion — no anti-forensics, standard encodings, detectable by signature-based tools
Limited lateral movement — stolen credentials, RDP, SMB with known tools
Basic persistence — scheduled tasks, registry run keys, known autostart locations
TACM-T1.toolingProfile: Public tools, cracked commercial tools, commodity malware kits

TACM-T2.label: Targeted Criminal
TACM-T2.description: Targeted spear-phishing with reconnaissance, credential harvesting, purchased access from initial access brokers, lateral movement with stolen credentials, ransomware deployment with data exfiltration. Invests effort in specific high-value targets.
tradecraftIndicators: Selective target selection — researches targets, purchases access from initial access brokers, industry-specific
Targeted spear-phishing with social engineering, watering holes, valid accounts from credential dumps
Modified tooling — customised phishing kits, commodity tools with modified configurations, purchased malware
Moderate evasion — obfuscation of scripts, timestomping, attempts to disable endpoint protection
Active lateral movement — credential harvesting, pass-the-hash, RDP pivoting, domain trust abuse
Moderate persistence — multiple persistence mechanisms, service creation, DLL search order hijacking
TACM-T2.toolingProfile: Modified commodity tools, customised phishing kits, purchased malware and access

TACM-T3.label: Organised / State-Proxy
TACM-T3.description: Custom tooling, living-off-the-land binaries (LOLBins), supply chain compromise via third parties, active counter-forensics (log clearing, timestomping, indicator removal), deep persistence mechanisms. Adapts TTPs when detected.
tradecraftIndicators: Deliberate target selection — specific organisations or sectors, intelligence-driven targeting
Supply chain via trusted third parties, trusted relationship abuse, zero-day in perimeter devices
Custom tooling — bespoke implants, living-off-the-land binaries (LOLBins), memory-only payloads
Active evasion — counter-forensics (log clearing, timestomping, indicator removal), process injection, AMSI bypass
Sophisticated lateral movement — Kerberoasting, golden/silver tickets, WMI/WinRM, DCSync, trust boundary crossing
Deep persistence — bootkit/rootkit, firmware implant, scheduled task via COM objects, WMI event subscription
TACM-T3.toolingProfile: Bespoke implants, living-off-the-land, memory-only payloads, custom C2

TACM-T4.label: State-Directed
TACM-T4.description: Zero-day exploitation, firmware/hardware implants, covert C2 over legitimate channels, long-term persistent access (months to years), operational security discipline, influence operations. Willing to burn expensive capabilities for strategic objectives.
tradecraftIndicators: Strategic target selection — national security, CNI, defence industrial base, diplomatic targets
Zero-day exploitation, hardware/firmware implants, insider recruitment, signals intelligence
Bespoke tooling — purpose-built for specific targets, modular C2 frameworks, covert channels over legitimate traffic
Comprehensive evasion — encryption of implant communications, steganography, traffic blending, timestomped forensic artifacts, operational security discipline
Patient lateral movement — low-and-slow, scheduled during business hours to blend, careful domain enumeration
Long-term persistence — firmware-level, BIOS/UEFI, virtualisation-layer, designed to survive reimaging
TACM-T4.toolingProfile: Purpose-built for specific targets, modular C2, covert channels, zero-day capabilities

TACM-T5.label: Strategic
TACM-T5.description: Supply chain subversion at source (SolarWinds-class), standards manipulation, pre-positioning in critical infrastructure, cross-domain operations (cyber + HUMINT + SIGINT). Only relevant for national security, CNI, and intelligence targets.
tradecraftIndicators: Global/systemic target selection — supply chains, infrastructure providers, protocol implementations, standards
Supply chain subversion at source, pre-positioned access, HUMINT-enabled cyber operations
State-of-the-art tooling — capabilities unknown until deployed, typically burned after single use
Operational evasion — entire operations designed to be unattributable, multi-year planning cycles
Pre-positioned lateral movement — access established years before operational use
Infrastructure-level persistence — embedded in vendor software (SolarWinds), hardware supply chain, firmware
TACM-T5.toolingProfile: State-of-the-art, single-use, unattributable, often burned after deployment
exampleOperations: Volt Typhoon (PRC pre-positioning in US CNI)
